definition: to be defeated on the battlefield/to be beaten in a contest
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: Mother and baby 2 game sigh and cry, the finally left Yi defeats and slept pass by.
sentences.chinese: 母子两比赛哭叫，最后左伊败阵，睡了过去。

sentences.english: New sources will be coming on line and China will lose out.
sentences.chinese: 新的替代资源很快就会出现，中国将会败阵下来。

sentences.english: And the people gat them by stealth that day into the city, as people being ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.
sentences.chinese: 那日众民暗暗地进城，就如败阵逃跑，惭愧的民一般。

sentences.english: He's got the memories of being crowned emperor and being defeated, conquering Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他拥有加冕为皇帝，败阵和征服欧洲的记忆。

sentences.english: He's got the memories of being crowned emperor and being defeated,conquering Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他拥有加冕为皇帝，败阵和征服欧洲的记忆。

definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to fight with all one's might
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
unable to determine victory or defeat (idiom); evenly matched/to come out even/to tie/to draw
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to beat the gong to recall troops (idiom); to order a retreat
troops in defeat like a landslide (idiom); a beaten army in total collapse
